NavigateEvent.summary: NOTE Experimental The NavigateEvent interface of the {{domxref("Navigation API", "Navigation API", "", "nocode")}} is the event object for the event, which fires when any type of navigation is initiated (this includes usage of {{domxref("History API", "History API", "", "nocode")}} features like ). NavigateEvent provides access to information about that navigation, and allows developers to intercept and control the navigation handling.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer
-Navigation API live demo (view demo source)

NavigateEventHasUAVisualTransition.summary: NOTE Experimental The hasUAVisualTransition read-only property of the interface returns true if the user agent performed a visual transition for this navigation before dispatching this event, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: User agents may provide a built-in visual transition when executing site navigations. If the site author also adds a visual transition, user agent and author transitions may conflict and confuse a visitor. The property lets you detect whether a UA transition was provided so that you can skip author transitions for a better user experience.

-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer
-Same-document view transitions for single-page applications

NavigateEventUserInitiated.summary:
NOTE Experimental The userInitiated read-only property of the
interface returns true if the navigation was initiated by the user (e.g., by clicking a link, submitting a form, or pressing the browser's "Back"/"Forward" buttons), or false otherwise.

blockquote.para: The table found at Appendix: types of navigations shows which navigation types are user-initiated.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventUserInitiated.value: A boolean value—true if the navigation is user-initiated, false if not.

NavigateEventDownloadRequest.summary:
NOTE Experimental The downloadRequest read-only property of the
interface returns the filename of the file requested for download, in the case of a download navigation (e.g., an {{htmlelement("a")}} or {{htmlelement("area")}} element with a download attribute), or null otherwise.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventDownloadRequest.value: A string containing the filename of the file requested for download, or null.

NavigateEventSignal.summary:
NOTE Experimental The signal read-only property of the
interface returns an , which will become aborted if the navigation is cancelled (e.g., by the user pressing the browser's "Stop" button, or another navigation starting and thus cancelling the ongoing one).

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventScroll.summary:
NOTE Experimental The scroll() method of the
interface can be called to manually trigger the browser-driven scrolling behavior that occurs in response to the navigation, if you want it to happen before the navigation handling has completed.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventSourceElement.summary:
NOTE Experimental The sourceElement read-only property of the
interface returns an object representing the initiating element, in cases where the navigation was initiated by an element.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventSourceElement.value: An object representing the element that initiated the navigation, or null if the navigation was not initiated by an element.

NavigateEventFormData.summary:
NOTE Experimental The formData read-only property of the
interface returns the object representing the submitted data in the case of a POST form submission, or null otherwise.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventInfo.summary:
NOTE Experimental The info read-only property of the
interface returns the info data value passed by the initiating navigation operation (e.g., , or ), or undefined if no info data was passed.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer
-Methods that allow info to be passed — , , , , and

NavigateEventInfo.value: The info value passed by the initiating navigation operation, or undefined if none was passed.

NavigateEventIntercept.summary:
NOTE Experimental The intercept() method of the
interface intercepts this navigation, turning it into a same-document navigation to the URL.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventNavigateEvent.summary: NOTE Experimental The NavigateEvent() constructor creates a new object instance.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventNavigationType.summary:
NOTE Experimental The navigationType read-only property of the
interface returns the type of the navigation — push, reload, replace, or traverse.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventNavigationType.value: An enumerated value representing the type of navigation.The possible values are:

NavigateEventDestination.summary:
NOTE Experimental The destination read-only property of the
interface returns a object representing the destination being navigated to.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventHashChange.summary:
NOTE Experimental The hashChange read-only property of the
interface returns true if the navigation is a fragment navigation (i.e., to a fragment identifier in the same document), or false otherwise.

remarks.para:
-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventHashChange.value: A boolean value—true if the navigation is a fragment navigation, false if not.

NavigateEventCanIntercept.summary:
NOTE Experimental The canIntercept read-only property of the
interface returns true if the navigation can be intercepted and have its URL rewritten, or false otherwise

remarks.para: There are several rules around when a navigation can be intercepted. For example:
See the spec for more explanation on when a Document can have its URL rewritten, including a table of examples.

-Modern client-side routing: the Navigation API
-Navigation API explainer

NavigateEventCanIntercept.value: A boolean value—true if the navigation can be intercepted, false if not.
